   "millchan": ["1NwwLdiFBcVAA4jXQ712ZtQfDHEMvk8BiD"],
   "nobody": ["1HfcDUpAgixShco52qfkVGyUjq7aybWHdG"],
   "peak.id": ["1PEAKf9wJLTEEFAsQpLeLioWfY1f8pvFhD"],
   "polar.id": ["1PoLARzautbsqCix1aia8jYN55JmPqGeFt"],
   "zeroid.bit": ["1iD5ZQJMNXu43w1qLB8sfdHVKppVMduGz"],

# Zeronet Trackers

**Tracker is** a computer (server) running special software that helps other computers (clients, peers) to connect each other.

ZeroNet is a peer to peer (P2P) network and by default is provided with the default list of trackers that helps user (peer) to interconnect with other peers. User can also **add custom trackers** via zeronet.conf or via [/Config](/Config) page. Adding new trackers is not necessary, because Zeronet application is made to automatically exchange trackers between zeronet users (peers).

24/7 running computer with public IP & ZeroNet software can **serve as a tracker** when ["bootstrapper" plugin](/1BLogC9LN4oPDcruNz3qo1ysa133E9AGg8/?Post:135:Changelog:+August+28,+2018) is enabled by renaming zeronetdirectory/plugins/disabled-Bootstrapper to zeronetdirectory/plugins/Bootstrapper and restarting ZeroNet.

Another option to become tracker is to run https://github.com/ZeroNetJS/zeronet-tracker on a nonstop running server with public IP.

# Zeronet Trackers

**Tracker is** a computer (server) running special software that helps other computers (clients, peers) to connect each other.

ZeroNet is a peer to peer (P2P) network and by default is provided with the default list of trackers that helps user (peer) to interconnect with other peers. User can also **add custom trackers** via zeronet.conf or via [/Config](/Config) page.

24/7 running computer with public IP & ZeroNet software can **serve as a tracker** when ["bootstrapper" plugin](/1BLogC9LN4oPDcruNz3qo1ysa133E9AGg8/?Post:135:Changelog:+August+28,+2018) is enabled by renaming zeronetdirectory/plugins/disabled-Bootstrapper to zeronetdirectory/plugins/Bootstrapper and restarting ZeroNet.

Another option to become tracker is to run https://github.com/ZeroNetJS/zeronet-tracker on a nonstop running server with public IP.

Beside manually adding new trackers to Zeronet, the application is also equiped with a feature that automatically exchange trackers between zeronet users (peers). This decrease chance all trackers be blocked and user be unable to connect any other users (peers).

# Zeronet Trackers

**Tracker is** a computer (server) running special software that helps other computers (clients, peers) to connect each other.

ZeroNet is a peer to peer (P2P) network and by default is provided with the default list of trackers that helps user (peer) to interconnect with other peers. User can also **add custom trackers** via zeronet.conf or via [/Config](/Config) page.

24/7 running computer with public IPv4 & ZeroNet software can **serve as a tracker** when ["bootstrapper" plugin](/1BLogC9LN4oPDcruNz3qo1ysa133E9AGg8/?Post:135:Changelog:+August+28,+2018) is enabled by renaming zeronetdirectory/plugins/disabled-Bootstrapper to zeronetdirectory/plugins/Bootstrapper and restarting ZeroNet.

Another option to become tracker is to run https://github.com/ZeroNetJS/zeronet-tracker on a nonstop running server with public IP. But when comparing this method of running tracker with previous method (bootstrapper plugin) in this case one possibly have to share the tracker IP and port manually with other zeronet users, in order to be useful.

Beside manually adding new trackers to Zeronet, the application is also equiped with a feature that automatically exchange trackers between zeronet users (peers). This decrease chance all trackers be blocked and user be unable to connect any other users (peers).

# Peer-to-Peer | [[Internet]]

**Peer-to-peer** (**P2P**) computing or networking is a distributed application architecture that partitions tasks or work loads between peers. Peers are equally privileged participants in the application. They are said to form a peer-to-peer network of [[nodes]].

Peers make a portion of their resources, such as processing power, disk storage or network bandwidth, directly available to other network participants, without the need for central coordination by servers or stable hosts. Peers are both suppliers and consumers of resources, in contrast to the traditional client-server model in which the consumption and supply of resources is divided.

Some P2P networks like ZeroNet are utilizing [[zeronet-trackers|trackers]] to help peers interconnect and other are using DHT.

# Peer-to-Peer | [[Internet]]

**Peer-to-peer** (**P2P**) computing or networking is a distributed application architecture that partitions tasks or work loads between peers. Peers are equally privileged participants in the application. They are said to form a peer-to-peer network of [[nodes]].

Peers make a portion of their resources, such as processing power, disk storage or network bandwidth, directly available to other network participants, without the need for central coordination by servers or stable hosts. Peers are both suppliers and consumers of resources, in contrast to the traditional client-server model in which the consumption and supply of resources is divided.

Some P2P networks like ZeroNet are utilizing [[trackers|zeronet-trackers]] to help peers interconnect and other are using DHT.

# Zeronet Trackers

**Tracker is** a computer (server) running special software that helps other computers (clients, peers) to connect each other.

ZeroNet is a peer to peer (P2P) network and by default is provided with the default list of trackers that helps user (peer) to interconnect with other peers. User can also **add custom trackers** via zeronet.conf or via [/Config](/Config) page.

24/7 running computers with public IPv4 and ZeroNet can **serve as a tracker** by enabling ["bootstrapper" plugin](/1BLogC9LN4oPDcruNz3qo1ysa133E9AGg8/?Post:135:Changelog:+August+28,+2018) by renaming zeronetdirectory/plugins/disabled-Bootstrapper to zeronetdirectory/plugins/Bootstrapper and restarting ZeroNet.

Another option to become tracker is to run https://github.com/ZeroNetJS/zeronet-tracker on a nonstop running server with public IP. But when comparing this method of running tracker with previous method (bootstrapper plugin) in this case one possibly have to share the tracker IP and port manually with other zeronet users, in order to be useful.

Beside manually adding new trackers to Zeronet, the application is also equiped with a feature that automatically exchange trackers between zeronet users (peers). This decrease chance all trackers be blocked and user be unable to connect any other users (peers).

# Zeronet Trackers

**Tracker is** a computer (server) running special software that helps other computers (clients, peers) to connect each other. ZeroNet  and it is also using trackers

ZeroNet is a peer to peer (P2P) network and by default is provided with the default list of trackers that helps user (peer) to interconnect with other peers. User can also **add custom trackers** via zeronet.conf or via [/Config](/Config) page.

24/7 running computers with public IPv4 and ZeroNet can **serve as a tracker** by enabling ["bootstrapper" plugin](/1BLogC9LN4oPDcruNz3qo1ysa133E9AGg8/?Post:135:Changelog:+August+28,+2018) by renaming zeronetdirectory/plugins/disabled-Bootstrapper to zeronetdirectory/plugins/Bootstrapper and restarting ZeroNet.

Another option to become tracker is to run https://github.com/ZeroNetJS/zeronet-tracker on a nonstop running server with public IP. But when comparing this method of running tracker with previous method (bootstrapper plugin) in this case one possibly have to share the tracker IP and port manually with other zeronet users, in order to be useful.

Beside manually adding new trackers to Zeronet, the application is also equiped with a feature that automatically exchange trackers between zeronet users (peers). This decrease chance all trackers be blocked and user be unable to connect any other users (peers).

# ZeroNet

**ZeroNet** is a [[decentralized]] network of [[peer-to-peer]] users. It is built in [[Python]] and fully [[open source]]. Sites have specific addresses which can be accessed through a browser when using its client. ZeroNet is not [[anonymous]] by default, but users can hide their IP address by using the built-in [[Tor]] functionality. ZeroNet uses elliptic curve [[cryptography]] and the [[BitTorrent]] network.

Users can publish static or dynamic websites into ZeroNet and visitors automatically serve the visited website from their computer, with the option to stop serving the website at any time by either pausing or deleting it. Sites will remain online even if it is being served by only one [[peer-to-peer|peer]].

When changes are published by the site owner, connected [[nodes]] serving that site (previous visitors) will receive the updates done to the site's content.

ZeroNet comes with a built-in [[SQL]] [[database]]. This makes content-heavy site development easy. The [[database]] is also synced with hosting [[nodes]].

The existence of [[peer-to-peer]] online [[website|websites]] had been hypothesized for some time, with [[The Pirate Bay]] suggesting they would build such network, as well as [[BitTorrent Inc.]] which created the closed source [[Project Maelstrom]]. One other similar project is [[MaidSafe]], though it has not yet seen widespread use, and has been said to focus more on file storage.

0net.io is the ZeroNet proxy created by d14na accessible via address [https://0net.io](https://0net.io).
d14na repository is on [Github](https://github.com/d14na/) and their official site address is [d14na.org](https://d14na.org)

# ZeroNet Proxies | [[ZeroNet]]

A proxy is a website that you can reach using any web-capable device that runs a multi-user [[ZeroNet]] instance. *[Learn how to host one](/kindlyfire.bit/?Post:9:Running+a+ZeroProxy)*. You can also install [[AWS Shadow Socks]].

## Currently Working
* [[0net.io]]
* [[bigcat.tk]]
* [[zero.heyitswither.tech]]

## Not Currently Working
* [[bit.surf]] (formerly bit.no.com) - Not Currently Working
* [[fuckcf.cf]] - Not Currently Working

# ZeroTalk | [[Social Network]]

[ZeroTalk](/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit) is a forum built by [[nofish]]. It allows for users to create topics and participate in conversations. It uses [[markdown]] to allow for rich text.

Like many other zites, ZeroTalk can be cloned (via site's ... menu on [ZeroHello](/)). Numerous users modified [their clones](/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1548256806_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS) adding new features like onsite search, image embeding.
